intro: Faramea fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant faramea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. The flowers emit a subtle, sweet aroma, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
